title: Brittney Griner Transferred to Russian Penal Colony
description: The U.S. basketball star, detained for more than eight months so far, is being transferred to an undisclosed prison in Russia, her lawyers said. The United States denounced the move.

title: Russia Orders Retreat From Kherson, a Serious Reversal in the Ukraine War
description: Russia’s position had grown perilous in Kherson, a strategic city and one of the biggest prizes seized in its Ukraine invasion, but Russian hawks reacted angrily to the withdrawal.

title: Poor Countries Need Climate Funding. These Plans Could Unlock Trillions.
description: As global warming delivers cascading weather disasters, leaders at U.N. climate talks in Egypt are increasingly calling for changes to a system that traps developing nations in debt.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: No ‘Red Wave’ in U.S. Midterms
description: Plus Russia says it is retreating from Kherson City and markets try to parse China’s “zero Covid.”

title: In Wake of U.S. Election, Ukrainian Lawmakers Will Reach Out to Washington
description: Officials are optimistic that Washington will continue to support the war effort. But a delegation is planning a trip to meet lawmakers of both parties.

title: Is Putin laying the groundwork for a cease-fire with the Kherson withdrawal order?
description: Some analysts saw the order as a reminder of President Vladimir Putin’s willingness to make tactical concessions.

title: For Britain’s New Leader, Politics at Home Overshadow a Smooth Global Debut
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s pragmatic diplomacy did not grab attention the way the resignation of a cabinet minister did.

title: Some Russian War Bloggers Denounce Kherson Withdrawal Order
description: “This betrayal is now carved up on my heart for centuries,” one military blogger wrote online. Another blogger lauded the move as a way to preserve the army.

title: Credibility Questions Dog World Bank President at Climate Summit
description: David Malpass has faced continuing criticism from those who question his commitment to climate action as well as the bank’s track record.

title: Germany Blocks 2 Foreign Investment Deals, Taking a Firmer Line on China
description: The decision to bar a Chinese-owned firm from acquiring a domestic semiconductor maker comes as Germany reappraises ties to its giant trading partner.

title: Putin’s Top Security Official Visits Iran as Russia Seeks Precision Weapons
description: The visit comes as Western and Ukrainian officials warn that Russia is trying to secure high-tech Iranian missiles and drones to deploy on the battlefield.

title: Jordan Is Running Out of Water, a Grim Glimpse of the Future
description: The small Middle Eastern nation is already one of the driest countries in the world and rising heat, coupled with a growing population, is making things much worse.

title: Dispute Over ‘Java Man’ Raises a  Question: Who Owns Prehistory?
description: An Indonesian claim against a Dutch museum has pushed the debate about restitution into the realm of the natural history museum — where it hasn’t been much of an issue until now.

title: After Near Wipeout in Election, Israeli Left Wonders: What Now?
description: Support for Israel’s left collapsed against Benjamin Netanyahu and his far-right alliance in last week’s election. To regain relevance, the left’s leaders say they need to change — but disagree on how.

title: Brittney Griner Is Being Moved to a Russian Penal Colony, Her Lawyers Say
description: The basketball player’s case has become part of a geopolitical struggle between Russia and the United States.

title: Adidas Cuts Forecast Again as It Contemplates Future for Yeezy Brand
description: The German sportswear company slashed its yearly forecast after dropping the popular Yeezy line over hate speech by its creator, Kanye West.

title: Adidas Lowers Earnings Forecast After Dropping Kanye West
description: The German sportswear company slashed its yearly forecast after dropping the popular Yeezy line over hate speech by its creator, Kanye West.

title: Migrant Ship, Turned Away by Italy, Heads Toward France
description: The new right-wing government allowed passengers on three vessels to disembark, but it stood firm on a fourth, a move that France denounced as “unacceptable.”

title: Midterm Election Results
description: The majorities in the House and the Senate remain uncalled. Here’s what we know.

title: China’s Great ‘Zero-Covid’ Guessing Game
description: Companies, investors and global policymakers are trying to divine when the Chinese government will drop its strict restrictions. It comes down to one man: the country’s top leader, Xi Jinping.

title: Brittney Griner Is Being Moved to Penal Colony, Lawyers Say
description: The process of transferring the W.N.B.A. star could take two weeks. The Biden administration has been seeking her release amid tensions with Moscow over the war.

title: Sea Turtle Sanctuary Has Survived 40 Years. Climate Change May Kill It.
description: Against long odds and initially strong opposition, a pristine marine preserve in the Philippines has thrived for decades under the care of local fishermen. Warming waters threaten the achievement.

title: How the Darién Gap Is Reshaping Migrant Journeys
description: The pandemic, climate change and growing conflict are forcing a seismic shift in global migration. In few places is that more clear than a perilous crossing called the Darién Gap.

title: Read Your Way Through Dublin
description: Virtuosity and creativity with language are “everyone’s birthright” in the Irish capital, says Tana French, an award-winning mystery writer who has made it her home.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Results from the U.S. midterm elections.

title: Deception and Trickery Are the Other Weapons in the Ukraine War
description: Both Russia and Ukraine are using confusion as well as artillery on the battlefield.
